item.title: Why I moved from WordPress to GitHub Pages
item.description: In the beginning… A few weeks before I had this website, I decided to open a blog. I Googled “how to create a blog”, and WordPress came up as a clear winner. I created an account, and got started pretty easy. I created a post, and got thrown to the block editor. It’s a WYSIWYG editor, which uses “blocks” as a way to define data and its properties. For example, one block can be a paragraph, the next one is a quote, and the next is an image.
